intro: Searsia pentaphylla, commonly known as the yellow whitlow or yellow bushwillow, is a shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with five pairs of leaflets. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by small, round, woody fruits. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh conditions.
